data.body:
Wow, this is really interesting! I've never seen the Pattern class before and I really think that this could help us. I'll have to read about it and format the isMultipleAnswerQuestion method to fit this style.
I think this code is good, one very small thing I noticed was that in comment for ANSWER_START has } instead of {, but that's it. I agree that how you do the newlines is good for now unless we hear otherwise.
It looks to me like answer start has [{], not [}], which ANSWER_END has. could you check again?
No, its in the comment above ANSWER_START, not in the expression. Again, its a very small thing and something that isn't important right now, its just something I noticed.
Ah, I see. I forgot to update those comments after changing the regular expressions. Ill do that and push real quick
Looks good to me!
Updated the documentation and added newlines as forbidden characters in the answer text
I reviewed all of your regex and it seems ready to push. Also the tests pass on my local.
That all looks good to me. I pulled it and tested it and it all seems to work nicely. gonna go ahead and merge

`::title::{//code}`
returns false now

`::title::title::Question{//code}`
returns true
but should return false
I think this is ready to merge (after fixing conflicts). Let me know what y'all think.
I checked it out and it all looks good to me. @lapenseerankinedl merge if you agree
Why TITLE + "?" when there's a ? already at the end of TITLE?
Yes I think you're looking at outdated code. When I was fiddling with it I added that. However in my final update I took this out.
Looks ready to merge. Let me know of any issues
This looks good to me, @Willowsap can you double check?
Looks good!
The indentation in the  isMultipleChoiceAnswer method looks a little wonky
Also, isn't it okay to omit the % % part of the answers if there is only one answer? I could be wrong
I believe willow is correct on it being optional
Ohhhhhhh. So the multiple choice single answer and multiple answers are different. So Danielle’s code is correct because each answer must have a % if the other answers do.
Spencer’s will be working on the single answer method
Okay, this looks good then
Looks good to me
@simbleau can you do a `make defchk` and fix checkstyle errors? I'm getting them on master from your function but I'm unsure how to fix these specific errors.
Awesome Thanks!
I just realized that this is on issue8 branch. It should be issue2. i apologize for that
I think that this looks good
Looks good to me as well. I am going to fix merging and pull again to make sure everything is working.
All tests pass, so I think we are good to merge to master.
Looks good
Looks good

General Feedback Regex added. I am unsure of rules. We need to ask PO for general feedback rules because they barely mention them on moodle documentation. Getting small issue done for future implementation.

So I was looking over the feedback rules for GIFT, and it seems that for the true/false question there can be one or two feedback, and the first feedback is the one that shows if you get it wrong, and the second feedback is the one that shows if you get it right.

@lapenseerankinedl yes I did that. 
Feedback has a question mark so 0 or 1 times. 
In my method I did + Feedback + Feedback. Therefore 0-2 feedbacks are accepted. This is also tested in my test cases.

technically I could have taken out the ? at the end of the FEEDBACK variable and assigned it {2,} in the True/false question method. However I though it would make it easier on you guys to keep it as is. Let me know what ya'll think.
Sorry, you're right, I looked over it again and I miscounted the number of trues! But in your test case the "Here is question text.{T#Right!#Wrong, think again}" should have #Wrong then #Right

@lapenseerankinedl Yes I see what you're saying. For our comprehension I'll fix this, but in general it doesn't matter what the feedback comment is, since we will not be able to determine if they wanted it to be for the correct or incorrect answer. Moodle will process it the same.

Ok, i implemented the feedback for the multiple answer question, let me know how it looks.
Also, for some reason, I cannot get a test to fail where there is multiple feedbacks in a row, and I want to ask one of you guys to try and figure that out. I'll continue to try to get it fixed, but I've tried for an hour and I can't seem to figure it out.
Ready to merge after someone reviews
Looks like everything works
READY FOR REVIEW

Ready for review. Tests all pass. Sorry to whoever has to review this.
I am good with this merge! Looks good

::Question 5::What does.{=a->b=arrow->->=c->a} 

I found out that this actually works. So matching question stayed the same other than adding a test to make sure this type of question passes. I also reverted FEEDBACK back to omitting only single characters

In case we need this format in the future and the hard work Spencer put in for documentation here is the line of code. Look ahead.
`private static final String FEEDBACK = "(#((\n|.)(?!((->)|\\^|\\{|\\}|\\#|\\%|\\~|\\=)))+(\n|.))";`
All tests pass. READY FOR REVIEW
This looks good
Looks good

This looks really great. I checked it out and ran everything.
This looks good

Look s good

Looks good
Looks good
Your solution looks correct, I would just add a space to the end of the new test to make sure it’s testing the space char.
@lapenseerankinedl did you see my last comment on that review? Regex is so tricky.

Small thing. I don't believe you need a newline there. Try:
`+ "[^{}#~=]*" + FEEDBACK + ")+";`

other than that it looks good!

Oh also I think I just noticed something that may be helpful:
`String matches = "(\\s*~\\s*%-?[0-9]+%[^{}#~=]*[^{}#~=\\s]"`
READY FOR REVIEW

Need help with errors above. @simbleau some issues with some of the new code and checkstyle. I'm unsure how to fix.

As for now, they can be safely ignored as Java 8 isn't properly checked in checkstyle. Checkstyle really hates lambdas.

I will refactor the lines to be simple enough for checkstyle to understand them. Do not merge yet!

I merged in Kaitlyn's checkstyle fixes, but there are still some checkstyle issues for @lapenseerankinedl to fix.

```
/src/verifier/problems/AtLeast1NegativePercentageProblem.java:41: warning: Line is longer than 80 characters.
/src/verifier/problems/AtLeast1NegativePercentageProblem.java:62:14: 'while' is not followed by whitespace.
/src/verifier/problems/AtLeast1NegativePercentageProblem.java:69:9: Conditional logic can be removed.
/src/verifier/problems/AtLeast1NegativePercentageProblem.java:69:11: 'if' is not followed by whitespace.
```

Fixed the checkstyle issues and optimized the methods.

However, there is still one issue I cannot seem to understand...? Not sure why it's saying the conditional logic can be removed. It can't as far as I can tell.
```
/src/verifier/problems/AtLeast1NegativePercentageProblem.java:51:9: Conditional logic can be removed.
```

This is the line it's referring to:
https://github.com/AgileAppstate/givecoco-the-caffeinated-pajama-bandits/blob/e218a7b32d848aafa61cb760ae533486b31c4c79/src/verifier/problems/AtLeast1NegativePercentageProblem.java#L51

Everything is working! Ready for Review and merge.
I'll be looking at this shortly.
What if it's \r\n\r\n? This would not split properly.

I added the second change since it seemed simpler. I imagine we will be donig a lot to this method in the future to better process files, so I don't think it is important to do everything ideally right now. Good catch though. Weird that I changed all the \b to \r\n in the verify methods but didnt do it there
Going to go ahead and merge this small bugfix.
